text: I'd check after a while. I found the low to be lower than I expected
I did the low temp on the slow cooker, and it was definitely too low. One side of the pan looks slightly caramelized. I'll try again on normal or high heat.
I have had 0 luck with the slow cooker function. If y’all figure it out, please lmk what I’m doing wrong.
at least I don't feel alone in my failure

>Both "High" and "Low" stabilize at the same temperature; it is just a matter of how long it takes to reach the simmer point. Once food reaches the simmer point, total cook time is dependent on cut and weight of meat to reach the point of maximum flavor and texture potential. Most dishes can be prepared on either "High or "Low."
i think it should all just be on high?
